attributes.action: Hold a second referendum on Brexit alongside the EU elections in May
attributes.additional_details:
The cost of delivering the 2016 EU referendum (not including campaign costs) was £94.5 million. The majority of this expense could be saved by running a referendum alongside another nationwide vote.

The cost of administering the poll – including the running of over 40,000 polling stations, issuing and opening postal votes, and the counting of votes – totalling £94.5 million.

Source: https://www.electoralcommission.org.uk
attributes.background: Given the current deadlock, the UK now needs to hold EU elections in May. This is an ideal opportunity to hold a second referendum on Brexit, and avoid a separate nationwide vote. This will confirm the will of the people either to leave or remain in the EU in the light of all current information.
